newsitem.title: USA: National Amusements to buy Viacom shares.
newsitem.headline: National Amusements to buy Viacom shares.

text.p: Viacom Inc said Thursday it and National Amusements Inc would embark on a repurchase program to buy up to $500 million of its own shares.
Viacom said they would each buy up to $250 million in shares.
It said National Amusements, which is controlled by Sumner Redstone, would buy from time to time shares of one or more classes of its Class A Common Stock and non-voting Class B Common Stock.
Viacom said it would also buy one or more classes of its outstanding warrants.
The two companies will finance the repurchase program from their respective working capital, it added.

National Amusements, which acquired control of Viacom in June 1987, owns about 65 percent of Viacom's Class A Common Stock and about 26 percent of its Class A and Class B Common Stock on a combined basis, it said.
Viacom is an entertainment and publishing company, owning the video movie chain store Blockbuster Video and rock video television channel MTV Networks, among others.
Viacom said Redstone might personally buy part of the $250 million that National Amusements had agreed to purchase.
